container.heading: Procedures for Clinical Demonstrations in Public Places

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter governs all chiropractic clinical demonstrations in public places by licensed chiropractors in Maryland.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
"Chiropractic display facility" means an area where chiropractic procedures are demonstrated.
"Chiropractic procedure" means examinations, mensurations, analyses, evaluations, screenings, or clinical determinations related to the practice of chiropractic in a public place.
"Cursory postural screening" means a visualization, by a licensed chiropractor, of an individual's posture to detect possible structural deviations.
"Demonstration" means performing chiropractic procedures in public places.
When performing chiropractic procedures in a public place, the chiropractor shall:
Prominently display the chiropractor's current license;
Provide adequate facilities for patients to disrobe in privacy;
Ensure that the patient is properly draped for examination; and
Maintain the privacy of the patient at all times.
The chiropractor may perform a cursory postural screening while the patient is fully clothed.

section.heading: Chiropractic Display Facilities in Public Places.
section.text: For procedures that require partial or complete disrobing of the patient, the chiropractor shall ensure that the chiropractic display facility provides sufficient patient privacy.

section.heading: Prohibitions.
section.text: An unlicensed individual may not perform chiropractic procedures in public places.

section.heading: Exceptions.
section.text: This chapter does not preclude a salesperson from demonstrating chiropractic equipment during a convention or educational seminar.

section.heading: Penalty.
section.text: The Board may initiate disciplinary proceedings, pursuant to Health Occupations Article, §3-313, Annotated Code of Maryland, against a chiropractor found in violation of this chapter.
